newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber mixed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber mixed in late trade.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber offer prices were mixed in lethargic late trade on Monday with traders still waiting for buyers to enter the market.

Traders said benchmark SIR20 for April/May shipment fell 0.25 cents to 53.00 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan and Surabaya. Offer prices eased to 52.75 fob Padang from 53.00, but levels rose 0.25 U.S. cents to 52.50 fob Palembang.

In Pontianak, offer prices rose to 52.50 from 52.00 in the morning while in Jambi, levels fell 50 U.S. cents to 52.00. "There are no fresh deals today. We are all frustrated because of this dull situation," said one trader.
Traders said they were willing to sell at the present prices but complained that buyers were difficult to find.
"If there are buyers, we are willing to sell no matter how low the prices are. The problem is who wants to buy?" said one trader.
Traders said supply was tight because of the current wintering, but prices did not move in the absence of buyers.
Some said they suspected that major consumers such as the United States and Europe had already enough stock.
